summary: The 'Sunshine on Solar Lending Act' amends the Truth in Lending Act to increase transparency in solar financing. It mandates creditors to clearly disclose dealer fees in solar financing transactions, including those charged to third parties. The bill defines "solar financing transaction" and prohibits arbitration clauses in these agreements. It aims to protect consumers by ensuring they understand the true cost of solar energy system financing, including costs of installation, maintenance, and related infrastructure.
